decks.notes: The deck focuses on playing aggressive Human creatures that benefit from each other's abilities, aiming to overwhelm the opponent quickly. Key cards such as Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant pump up the team, while disruptive creatures like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter disrupt the opponent's strategy. Aether Vial provides flexibility in deploying creatures at instant speed, while mana-fixing lands like Unclaimed Territory and Cavern of Souls ensure that the deck's multicolored creatures can be cast easily. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around a fast and disruptive aggro game plan fueled by synergistic Human creatures.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like All Is Dust, Chalice of the Void, and Thought-Knot Seer. It also includes cards like Karn Liberated and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger for late-game dominance. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures while controlling the battlefield with removal spells and disruption. The mana base is optimized to consistently cast the deck's high-cost threats, ensuring a steady stream of powerful plays throughout the game.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the Dredge mechanic to quickly fill the graveyard with cards, allowing for the constant recursion of creatures like Bloodghast and Prized Amalgam. By sacrificing cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug, players can trigger powerful abilities and create overwhelming board presence. The inclusion of cards like Conflagrate and Creeping Chill provide additional reach and utility, while Faithless Looting and Life from the Loam help maintain the engine of the deck. This combo-focused strategy aims to overwhelm opponents with an endless stream of threats from the graveyard.

The deck revolves around the combo of ramping up lands with cards like Farseek and Sakura-Tribe Elder to quickly get to the 7 lands needed to cast Scapeshift. Once Scapeshift is cast, it allows the player to sacrifice their lands and search for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and other Mountains, dealing massive damage to the opponent. Primeval Titan can also help search for Valakut and ramp up the lands. The deck also includes removal and graveyard hate to disrupt the opponent's strategy.

This deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent through direct damage spells and aggressive creatures. The goal is to put pressure on the opponent early in the game and finish them off before they can stabilize. Cards like Lightning Helix and Boros Charm provide versatile spells that can both deal damage and provide utility, while creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear hit hard and fast. The deck utilizes efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Searing Blaze to clear the path for its creatures to attack.

The main concept of the deck is to control the game by assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine) to generate a large amount of mana and cast powerful threats like Karn Liberated, Wurmcoil Engine, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck also includes removal options like Oblivion Stone and Walking Ballista, as well as card selection with Ancient Stirrings and Sylvan Scrying. The goal is to outvalue and outlast the opponent while controlling the board and closing out the game with high-impact threats.

Utilizing graveyard interactions and self-mill, this deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with key creatures and then bring them back onto the battlefield to overwhelm the opponent, potentially winning the game in a single explosive turn. The deck uses cards like Cathartic Reunion and Faithless Looting to cycle through the deck quickly while triggering effects like Creeping Chill and Prized Amalgam. Life from the Loam helps to ensure a steady stream of lands. The goal is to create a powerful board presence and outpace the opponent with an unstoppable combo.

The focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively play low-cost spells to deal damage to the opponent. By using cards like Skewer the Critics, Lava Spike, and Lightning Bolt, along with creatures like Soul-Scar Mage and Monastery Swiftspear, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. Faithless Looting and Manamorphose help with card draw and mana fixing, while Arclight Phoenix serves as a powerful finisher. Bedlam Reveler provides a source of card advantage in the mid to late game.

The deck is focused on utilizing spirits with a focus on aggression to overwhelm opponents. Cards like Drogskol Captain, Supreme Phantom, and Spell Queller help enhance the spirit creatures, while Aether Vial and Collected Company provide ways to quickly get them onto the battlefield. The deck also includes some disruption with Deputy of Detention and Reflector Mage, as well as some protection with Selfless Spirit. Overall, the strategy is to quickly build a board presence and pressure opponents with a mix of efficient creature threats and disruptive spells.

The main concept of this Combo Dredge deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures like Bloodghast, Narcomoeba, and Prized Amalgam using cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion. By utilizing Life from the Loam to continuously return lands to hand, the deck can trigger powerful graveyard abilities such as Creeping Chill and Conflagrate. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive graveyard strategy, utilizing dredge mechanics to quickly build up a board presence and deal damage.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with spells to bring back Arclight Phoenix and trigger Thing in the Ice's transformation. It utilizes low-cost spells like Gut Shot, Manamorphose, and Faithless Looting to generate value and maintain aggression. The combination of powerful creatures like Crackling Drake and Young Pyromancer alongside burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Flame Slash ensures aggressive pressure and consistent damage output. The deck capitalizes on synergy between cards to create a fast and relentless tempo, overwhelming opponents before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Dredge mechanic to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Life from the Loam and Faithless Looting, allowing for powerful combos with cards like Bloodghast, Narcomoeba, and Prized Amalgam. By consistently dredging cards into the graveyard, the deck can quickly assemble a powerful board state with multiple threats that can overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Creeping Chill and Conflagrate for additional reach and removal, making it a versatile combo deck that can quickly close out games.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly fill up the graveyard with spells by using cheap cantrips and discard spells, in order to enable the powerful recursion of Arclight Phoenix. The deck aims to play aggressively, utilizing efficient removal like Lightning Bolt and Lightning Axe, while also having threats like Thing in the Ice and Crackling Drake to back up the Phoenixes. The deck also includes some evasion and haste granting spells like Maximize Velocity to close out games quickly. It aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of tempo and recursion.

This deck focuses on early aggressive plays with powerful creatures like Dark Confidant, Tarmogoyf, and Scavenging Ooze while disrupting the opponent's game plan with discard spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize. It also has efficient removal spells in Assassin's Trophy, Fatal Push, and Maelstrom Pulse to clear the way for your creatures. The deck features solid mana base to support its game plan and some utility lands like Field of Ruin and Treetop Village. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and disrupt the opponent's strategy to secure victory.

The deck is focused on controlling the game through counterspells, removal spells, and card draw while eventually winning the game with powerful threat cards like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Nahiri, the Harbinger. It aims to stall the game and disrupt the opponent's game plan before closing out the game with a big finish. The deck uses a combination of control elements, card advantage, and powerful finishers to outlast the opponent and secure victory.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana and card advantage to assemble the necessary pieces for a game-winning combo. It utilizes cards like Manamorphose, Gifts Ungiven, and Baral, Chief of Compliance to reduce costs and increase efficiency. Once the combo pieces are in hand, the deck can cast multiple spells in a single turn, ending with a lethal Grapeshot. The key to success lies in effectively managing resources, digging through the deck for the missing pieces, and carefully timing the storm count to overwhelm the opponent in a burst of spells.
